website_summaries.verdict: Thick carbon steel blade provides excellent durability. Comfortable handle for using for long periods.
pros: Size and weight suit a variety of uses
Great knife for processing small game and for precise work
Carbon steel blade is easy to sharpen
Finger guard on handle for safety
cons: Blade length is a little short at less than four inches
Blade may collect stains with certain cutting jobs

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp, carbon steel will rust. I putted a patina on it and it lost the razor sharp edge.
customer_reviews.text: Being this the knife I always use I putted a protective black patina soaking it in boiling vinegar. The chemical reaction is quite fierce. But seems to me that the patina made it lose its original razor sharpness putting on the blade a powdery like sticking coating. I now will have to re-sharpen the Scandi grind and perhaps it will look like a lil Cold Steel machete. I wouldn't force a patina again on a carbon knife. I will just wait for it to develop naturally. The difference between the patinated Mora Craftline Robust and the un-patinated Mora Craftline Basic is in the cutting video.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Orsini ft Spotty Coniglietto.

customer_reviews.title: All the quality at a 10th of the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best knife for the money ever. At this price I don't feel bad beating up this blade. I do a lot of backpacking and this knife is on every trip. From fire making to cutting up cheese and crackers you can't go wrong. I drilled a small hole in the handle for a lanyard and ground the spine 90° for fire starting. Just an awesome workhorse of a blade!
customer_reviews.author: Judah James

customer_reviews.title: So the knife itself is cool, I made the mistake of buying the Carbon ...
customer_reviews.text: So the knife itself is cool, I made the mistake of buying the Carbon one (That's not on Morakniv that's on me clicking purchase on the wrong one) it's a good knife, so much so that I turned around when I realized I got the wrong one and bought another one in stainless. I'm not into having to oil a blade to prevent rust, that's just one more thing to add to a long list of other things that i have to worry about. So this one will stay home, but the quality is there, i'll just be using the stainless version more.
customer_reviews.author: Dorgin

customer_reviews.title: Big Bang for your Buck.
customer_reviews.text: Unbeatable quality for price point. The level of quality control is something that has left me extremely surprised. The blade itself is very thick and sturdy, very good as a multi - purpose blade. Handle very easy to hold and maintain grip. The sheathe may appear to be flimsy however this is not the case as the plastic is quite sturdy and even has a purpose build hole on the bottom so any wetness or liquid in the sheathe can leak out. This level of care towards an uncoated carbon steel blade is very important as it is an extra step they needn't take yet they did. Bravo,
customer_reviews.author: Lawliet L.

customer_reviews.title: Buy one NOW, use WHENEVER, for WHATEVER!
customer_reviews.text: This item is one of my favorite gifts. If you aren't an outdoorsman you may not know about these knives. If you are an outdoorsman, you have 5. The knife is full-tang, so it will support the weight of a man if you hammer it into a tree. This Mora in-particular is thicker than most, so should last longer and be much sturdier. I've used this knife for cutting boxes, dressing a rabbit, cleaning fish, and a bunch of little things too... No complaints. Buy one. Use whenever, for whatever.
customer_reviews.author: McJerkins

customer_reviews.title: Best deal for a camp knife!
customer_reviews.text: High carbon laminated Swedish steel- Lightweight Grippy SAFE two type handle - Mora grind - Extremely strong- Tested 100/100 Morakniv blades are hands down my favorite Bushcrafting, camping, work and more knife- I carry them around the house because they work for slicing fruit, vegetables and kitchen duties- If you are a homesteader and working with a budget, get a morakniv or 3, honestly you cannot beat these blades and this particular one is my favorite hands down the grip makes it safe by default. The steel is high end laminated and well tempered
customer_reviews.author: Just_a_DadTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Thick, durable and when paired with the rope version, an unbeatable set!
customer_reviews.text: I have this paired (Ranger banded) with myand together they form an unbeatable pair. This is actually a very stout knife with a thick blade. I have a number of Mora's and this seems the most durable of them all. Thick, sharp and it's a Mora... What more can you say? (FYI... Mora, PLEASE make a "left handed option" on the Craftline sheaths... Pretty please....)
customer_reviews.author: Art-the-MouseTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A very good knife. Thick strong blade good for tough utility use. I have abused this in as many ways as I could think of from cutting carpet for removal to cutting tin cans and copper wires. This knife is hard enough to hold an edge well yet can still be sharpened easily. Again my only issue is with the clunky plastic sheath. Although the sheath is functional and has held up well so far, I must say I can't speak to the longevity of it. That being said this knife's price is such that there is no excuse to not have one in the shop, toolbox, tackle box, glove box and junk drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Noteableenigma

customer_reviews.title: Good camp knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use as a camp knife. I wear it on the waist of my pants, not on a belt, and the sheath is very tight, in fact it is hard to remove when I want to take it off! The knife is handy, I haven’t used it for anything difficult yet, just for cutting lightweight things. No pounding on firewood, for example. It is sharp out of the box. It is simple, serves its purpose, and a good bargain. If I get in a fight with a mountain lion, I will return to update this review, if able.
customer_reviews.author: Marta SolitaireTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good product but........................
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product but the one I received must have been a second or a return. It did not arrive in a box,the spine was unfinished,and there was a defect(chip) in the tip. I will order another one and I am hoping Amazon will inspect it before they ship it. Since, I have purchased the Morakniv heavy duty companion. It arrived in a box and looks like a real good knife. Just received my second Robust knife......................I love it ! It came very sharp! I prefer the grip compared to the Morakniv Companion Heavy Duty knife. My favorite inexpensive knife.
customer_reviews.author: DannyBoy

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned some expensive knives, and some cheaper ones. This one is good for someone who needs a knife on a budget. Have used it at least 3-4 days a week for about 3 months now and I haven't had to sharpen it or have noticed it degrading at all. I haven't had the blade snap even though I've dropped it multiple times from various heights. (4-16 ft)
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: One tough knife...
customer_reviews.text: This is one tough knife. I got it for my partner for camping and I wanted to make sure they had a knife that was good for everything. It can carve, prep food, gut fish, and process some small firewood. Pretty damn tough knife. Make sure that you use olive oil on it to clean it if you’re going to use it on food. It will rust if you don’t. It’s also very sharp. Be careful. The “sheath” it comes with sucked so I replaced it with a leather one I found online (4”).
customer_reviews.author: Karen Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Much heftier than the Basic 511 I bought a couple weeks ago
customer_reviews.text: New to Mora knives, but like what have received so far... Really like the heft and balance of this one. So far it seems more suited to a wider variety of general tasks than the basic. Came razor sharp as advertised, just ran it over the strop a time or to to finish it off. Will be doing the apple cider vinegar forced patina as that seems to hold up well on basic 511. Other reviewers who complaine d about handle must have Giant hands... this fits my hand as if made for it... I wear a size L/XL GLOVE.
customer_reviews.author: Jon  Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Makes a fair utility knife around camp
customer_reviews.text: You could do far worse for far more money. This is more than worth the $10 USD, to me. I knocked off a star because, although the sheath feels nice when you put the knife into it... it’s still pretty fragile. I will only use it for seasonal storage. For a laugh... check out the packaging if came in 🤣🤣🤣 (The knife was the only thing in the shipment.)
customer_reviews.author: emeacham

customer_reviews.title: Buy this RIGHT NOW and stop hesitating
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my friend has a Companion and it is amazing. I got mine and I couldnt be happier. The knife feels amazing, the handle is awesome, and the steel quality is great. Shaves my arm and slices paper with ease. I was stuck between this and the Pro C but I am glad I got this for its extra blade thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I NEED MORE MORAKNIV!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS KNIFE. I caught the Mora bug and will probably get all of them now. Aside from that.. this thing is super sharp and durable, does all the stuff you need around camp and then some. I carry it with me every where. Naturally, I did all the modifications to the knife—patina on the blade and some paratinder around the sheath, you know, cuz I am a noobie survivalist who really just has a lot of cool camping gear now. At any rate, I did the tinder prep with it and had it on me for cooking. It’s an essential tool!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jo

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp, but tip broke off
customer_reviews.text: Bought prior to deer season, the knife was working like a charm, very sharp, easy to hold. Then while deboning a deer the tip broke off, no excessive force, just snapped. Still very sharp knife and I was impressed until this happened. Only used it once
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the money
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the Companion, the blade is a little shorter but nearly twice as thick. It is also a little bit wider. When I received it, I was a little bit disappointed that the spine of the blade was not cleaned. The steel was rolled over and looked unfinished. A little bit of time with a diamond stone and it was ready to use on a ferro rod. The factory edge wasn't bad, but sharpened up easily and held it's edge while carving wood. Overall, it's great little knife and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Pospisil

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Super edge and mirror polish, exept on the unfinished spine, just like it says on the description. Good grip on the rubber part of the handle. The blade seems thicker than I imagined, but it's just like they said it would be, double tough! Very happy! I think I'll square up the spine on sandpaper on the table edge to make it match the stunning good looks of the rest of the blade! Put some oil on the blade right away to keep it shinny for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: bruce wayne

customer_reviews.title: It's a Mora... they're good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Used within the limits of their design and many times beyond those limits, Mora blades have cemented their reputation with positive comments by hundreds of users before me. I've nothing much more to add other than the fact my owning a few of them so that must say something. Great addition to anyone's outdoor arsenal. Buy more than one... their bang for the buck is indisputable.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Puts most cheap knives to shame.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. Wish it was a little longer though. It's kinda short, but other than that this little guy can take a punch. High carbon steel with a tang that goes all the way through the handle. Could ask for anything more than that in a quality knife especially for the price. That's the best thing about Mora most of their knives are relatively cheap, but aren't made cheap. Can't say the same with say a brand like SOG. You pay way to much for a cheaply made knife.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Phillips

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorites
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a knife nut here, have a whole array of knives, mostly value knives but also some Benchmades, higher-end Bokers, etc. but Moras have always been one of my favorite knives for camping/utility knives. Obviously not a great everyday carry, but it's the perfect knife that you can beat the living crud out of while camping and it handles the abuse perfectly and it also wouldn't be the end of the world if you lost/broke it (although I adore it too much to lose it). Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Xu

customer_reviews.title: You can’t beat a mora for value.
customer_reviews.text: You can not beat a mora for quality vs cost. You just can’t. Great blade. It’s not for batoning huge pieces of wood. It will take care of carving and splitting small sticks for firewood starting. It’s a sturdy blade great all purpose I would definitely recommend these to the woodsman or hiker in your family. Note. You may have to square the sprint if you want to use it to get a spark for fire starting.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Finn

customer_reviews.title: A great all-around knife!
customer_reviews.text: This knife, though it doesn't have a full tang blade, is strong, rust-resistant and literally razor-sharp right out of the box. I have used mine for woodworking tasks as well as when camping outdoors. The Scandi grind of the blade provides a strong, lasting edge which is easily sharpened also. The tactile grip makes it secure in the hand, even when it's wet. A true quality-made item.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Richards

customer_reviews.title: Spend no more.
customer_reviews.text: These knives get zip tied to the steering station of both of our boats. They get over used and treated like cheap tools. I can’t tell you how incredible these $15 blades are. The salt and the sun in SW Florida will degrade a &200 knife just as fast, maybe faster. Very impressed. I buy them 3 at a time they last 2 years I don’t even dignify them with a wipe off. Capt. John
customer_reviews.author: John Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Very ROBUST Knife!! Quality on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Carbon steel outdoors knife by Mora! This thing is thick enough to take any abuse you might dish out... Came very sharp,and gets even scarier sharp with a quick strop! For a BOB knife,or a truck knife,or a camp knife this thing is a Beast and it screams quality! I have high end knives as well,but if you want something you can beat on for a Lifetime without worrying about esthetics/looks,this is a great option at an Amazing price! I'm very happy with my Mora Robust!!
customer_reviews.author: Knife guy

customer_reviews.title: This knife is scary awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This knife really surprised me out of the box. I took all the other reviews with a grain of salt, but honestly it's the real deal. I've been handling knives all my life and never, not EVER, have I actually been afraid of how sharp or strong a knife was. This knife would probably put Chuck Norris to shame. It gives you the cutting edge and the spine strength that I have never seen in a knife like this before. If you're looking for an EDC or something for part of a BoB, get this thing. You will never regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Hands down one of the best knives for your money
customer_reviews.text: I love the shape of the handle and the rubber in the grip. The knife comes razor sharp out of the box. Gotta be extremely careful when using it. It cuts so effortlessly. I got the robust because I’m a bit harder on my knives, and I need my knives to be stronger so they don’t fail me on the field. I have a ton of large knives to handle the bigger tasks, but I needed a smaller knife to handle the smaller finer tasks like feathering sticks for starting fires, cutting notches for tent steaks, cutting chord and rope, etc. This is the best small knife I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: John Sutton

customer_reviews.title: It is so easy to sharpen and it holds a sharp edge very ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Mora. I have many knives that cost many times more than the Mora Robust, but I use it more than any other knife. It is so easy to sharpen and it holds a sharp edge very long for a carbon blade. I haven't had to sharpen it yet, just strop after prolonged or heavy use. I recommend the Companion Robust for the extra length on the blade and pretty much the same thickness.
customer_reviews.author: C. from TX

customer_reviews.title: Best knife I have bought in a while.
customer_reviews.text: Best knife Ibhave bought in a while. Atirdy, compact, sharp, and comfortable to use. Using for a “one knife challenge” and it has performed flawlessly through many tasks for a month so far in kitchen, in the woods, on the dinner plate, or in the jobsite. Have used to cut everything from wire sheathing to a ribeye steak. Edge holds and only have to “strop” it on a strip of 2000 grit sandpaper to bring back the razor. Makes a really good “neck knife” by adding paracord lanyard. I wear mine everywhere I go.
customer_reviews.author: Don Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a nice price.
customer_reviews.text: Morakniv Craftline Robust Trade Knife Carbon. Bought this as a secondary camp/survival knife. The price was right. Considering the price, the quality is excellent. This is my second Mora knife. The other is a stainless Bacho/Mora that came with a saw. Anyhow, the first gave me incentive to look into a second. Again, great quality. My only knock against it is a worry that it's not locked super securely into the sheath. The reasons I picked this over other Mora knives. 1. Thicker/stronger carbon steel blade. 2. Better finger guard for keeping the hand from slipping forward onto the blade.
customer_reviews.author: BINGO

customer_reviews.title: A Mora so Good, I Outfitted my Whole Troop with them!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite Morakniv, especially for bushcraft. Battoning, carving, cutting rope you name it. A great value for the money. Super thick blade and full length stick tang encased in plastic handle mean incredible durability and reliability. Came super sharp and the Scandi grind is very easy to get even sharper, and I am not one of those waterstone wizards. Learn how to take care of carbon steel and you have a great knife for life!
customer_reviews.author: ALEKS

customer_reviews.title: but I love this particular Mora
customer_reviews.text: I have plenty of knives, some very expensive, but I love this particular Mora. For the price they are practically disposable. Whenever I travel to remote, austere locations overseas I always have one of these with me. Why this instead of something else? Easy - it's cheap, it's tough, I don't care too much if it is confiscated at customs, and I can always trade it for something cool when I'm headed back home. My kids each have one of these guys in their collection, I keep one in every vehicle, and I also keep one in my Fire Department turnout kit.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Black

customer_reviews.title: Its a Mora!
customer_reviews.text: Like all Mora knives this one is no exception. Simple, sharp and durable. Buy with confidence. No issues at all with this knife and sharp as all the others I've bought. I love these knives for their price, durability and their ability to hold an edge. I've used them in field situations and survival situations with no issues, despite not having a full tang construction. I love and will keep buying Mora knives.
customer_reviews.author: T. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  Better than the Companion
customer_reviews.text: Perfect knife! I had bought the Companion and I didn't like the balance between handle size/shape and blade size/shape. I didn't feel safe working with the Companion, if that makes sense. Once I bought the Craftline I knew instantly it was a better fit and felt so much better in the hand. The blade shape is very nice (almost like a rounded tanto) and the thickness of the blade instills a good deal of confidence when putting it to tough use. Blade wise, it is very sharp, holds the edge well. Even though the blade is thicker, I was still able to do delicate work with it when needed. Great knife and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic knife.
customer_reviews.text: This knife came out of the box razor sharp and was able to shave with ease. The day it came in the mail I took it camping and it performed great from feather sticking and fire making. I would highly recommend this knife. If you'd like to see this knifes performance check out DBK on YouTube after watching their video on this knife I was ready to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: River S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your Buck.
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying this is one of the best tools you can buy for $15. This knife comes out of the box razor sharp. The sheathe is a typical plastic mora knife sheathe from what I hear. The spine of the knife is the only thing I dislike about this knife. The spine is unfinished and has sharp ridges all along it, had to take a file and a grinder to make it better.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Robust is an understatement!
customer_reviews.text: Geeze! This knife is a beast even if it was twice it's price! A super strong utility knife with edge retention that defines logic. Mora has a real hit on their hands here. Strong. Supple in the hands. Edge retention beyond belief. And comfortable grip and use. Its never far from my reach!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M

customer_reviews.title: Best blade value. Period
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I've been using this daily for a couple months. I've beaten this knife up consistently and it doesn't flinch. It's a little thick for fine slicing but obviously that's why it's the "robust". The sheath is very functional but I made a kydex one to carry a bit higher so my toolbelt doesn't block its use. I also did a quick copper plate to protect the blade. If you're thinking about buying this knife, buy 2. You'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gassy279

customer_reviews.title: I love this knife
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife; it came sharp and ready to go. The handle is a good size and provides a solid grip, the blade is slightly shorter than the handle. The sheath is solid plastic and will clip on to your pants or belt really well. My only problem with this knife is that it appears to be incomplete, the spine is rough and unpolished. Still you can’t beat the price on this knife for the quality. Next knife I buy will probably also be a Morakniv.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it love it love it. Nice knife filed the spine to a 90 degree edge to get sparks from a fire steel. Comfortable and sharp no complaints very sturdy well made useful knife. Only complaint is the sheath don’t care the sheath at all wish it had a leather sheath with an insert and a closed loop belt loop with a swivel ring to be more useful and comfortable wearing.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Made me a fan of the brand!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing knife that holds up well after use and retains it edge. Easy to sharpen and feels great to hold and use. I can't find anything to complain about with this knife, however I'm not a huge fan of the sheath design. That said it does what it's supposed to do and does it well. Will be buying more Mora knives in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Glenn

customer_reviews.title: What's Not to Love?
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy knife for general purpose field and yard environments. I wear this anytime I'm outside and never fail to find a use for it. Super value and very durable. Check out YouTube for some really excellent reviews on this knife. Will not disappoint
customer_reviews.author: Chez

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: Knife feels great in the hand. There's a certain quality feel to it. The grip is great, so is the sheath. The blade is 1/8" thick and feels rock solid. Great knife for pretty much everything, including knife abuse. I'd argue this is still a value purchase even at double the price. 10/10 IGN, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: revelation

customer_reviews.title: What a knife!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is an absolute tank. Nothing I've thrown at it as a fabricator and city maintenance worker has slowed it down. No chipped or rolled edges and the sheath and handle construction are next-to-none. I'd highly recommend this knife to those who need an indestructible beast of a knife on a budget. I'm only giving it four stars due to the unground spine. I understand it lowers production costs and 'strengthens' the blade, but having a ninety degree spine on a carbon steel knife is really a must. If you have the means to reprofile the spine to that configuration yourself, it's an easy five star blade.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: It's a tool - not a museum piece!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is the sh!t!!! When I was ready to remodel the kitchen top to bottom, I knew I wanted a "sacrificial" knife to have on my hip for whatever. I pried, I cut, I chopped, I hammered with it and it's still in great shape. All these complaints about the raw spine - I'm cracking up. Seriously - this is a ridiculously priced knife that is extremely durable, holds an edge incredibly well, and I won't trade for anything. There is no reason to wonder about quality - it is a tool that does it's job well. Get one.
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: Super strong!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is super strong really thick blade. Not the prettiest, but seems super practical. Amazon wants me to write more but that's all I have to say. UPDATE: The blade is really TOO thick and sometimes makes it hard to use. It is durable and strong but unnecessarily thick
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This thing came unbelievably sharp in the box, but someone who tried to sharpen it for me really butchered the edge, so I had a buddy of mine put the original scando grind back on it with his shop tools, and this knife has held that edge for several strong use bushcraft and camping trips. It doesn't everything I need it to do and even better than a lot of far more expensive knives can. I would absolutely buy this knife again and will be buying some for my friends who are into bushcraft and backpacking or just as a general use knife.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Smith

customer_reviews.title: A Good, Versatile Knife at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good knife and sheath for the price. It came with a nice edge and it was useful for every task I needed it for on a weekend camping trip. You can use it for cutting food, peeling bark, and even splitting small pieces of firewood.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Quiggle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money...
customer_reviews.text: One of the few carbon steel knives I own (I usually prefer stainless steel). This knife is a beast and is more than worth the money. One of the best values in fixed blade knives today. Very sharp right out of the package. To help counter rust on the blade, consider forcing a patina by simply wrapping the blade in paper towels soaked in ordinary vinegar. Let set a few hours and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: wheelgunner

customer_reviews.title: it’s really better suited for A craftsman than an outdoorsman I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is indeed a robust blade I originally bought it thinking I would throw it in a back pack for outdoor activities but it ended up in my toolbox... it’s really better suited for A craftsman than an outdoorsman I have other moras that ended up with the “camping” gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mikeg23

customer_reviews.title: Can’t get a better knife at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Mora. Exactly what I expected from them. The spine is polished but not flat and the blade has 2 blemishes, if you could even call them that, they are so minute. And I love that the spine and blade are like this because it shows that they don’t have to produce a perfect knife. I buy these knives because they work and are quality. Not because they’re beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Leoxagon

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap knife you will ever buy
customer_reviews.text: For 10 bucks this is the best knife iver ever had, sharp as a razor thick blade supper tuff. Watch the torture test on YouTube. I've cut everything from fruit to flooring with this baby. Your not gana find a better all around knife for this price Trust me.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: A great all around knife
customer_reviews.text: Over the years i have added more than a few knives to my collection and of them, 6 Morakniv models....of all of them this is the best....it has the thickest spine on the blade, a short but beefy and razor sharp scandi edge and a great handle/grip. As with all of the Morakniv's the sheath is a basic, functional plastic which I like as the tab at the top allows you to use it in a neck-knife wear as well as belt/webbing mount as well. Though this model is aimed at the construction/utility audience, as a camp/bushcraft/woodcraft knife, it is one of my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: My Side Of The Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: 1/8" thick very sharp blade, works great as an all around knife. I bought a total of 6 of these knives and gave them to my adult daughters, keep one in each car and use one for everyday box opening, etc. At $13 a good stout knife!
customer_reviews.author: Tonka

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Carbon Steel Utility Knife
customer_reviews.text: Great tough sharp carbon steel utility knife and is great for common tasks. I have one of these in carbon and another Pro S in stainless. Good to have for jobs around the house. Would work for bushcrafting but you will have to sharpen the spine with a file for the firesteel.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Stout sharp affordable
customer_reviews.text: Stout and sharp. Well done edge geometry. Handle is very nice in most grip positions, may cause issues for XL hands. Grip texture is great. Due to the increased steel thickness it feels shorter than my pro S model, though length is identical. Sheath is alright. My tension was good but not great. Price was amazing
customer_reviews.author: WeaponsCash

customer_reviews.title: returned and got a new one
customer_reviews.text: the first knife I received couldn't cut my steak in my kitchen. I tried my other knives thinking the steak was tough. Nope, the Helle cut like butter, the steak knife worked fine, Bark River easy. I returned this knife, Amazon sent me another and the new one cuts... Weird quality control.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gabbert

customer_reviews.title: Badges blade
customer_reviews.text: This is my new everyday carry knife would be perfect for fishing camping hiking mountain climbing anything to do outdoors and it's so robust that you can share you can catch on with it and hit it with the back of a amp it's very strong mind you the stainless steel does come sharper than the car carbon steel is stronger so you decide for yourself. I hope you all enjoyed the review thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Agent K

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I'm very impressed. The knife comes decently sharp with a slight microbevel but a few minutes on a high-grit stone brought it to hair-whittling sharpness. Takes a nice patina too.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Reusch

customer_reviews.title: Embarrasses expensive blades very easily!! Just buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest knife I own make many of my expensive knifes feel cheap! Great edge retention and super easy to put a edge on. Light and balanced enough for fine work but robust enough for heavier jobs. It is so versatile it has become the right tool for most jobs! The value isn’t great, it is beyond that. More of a down right AMAZING value.
customer_reviews.author: JustSomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: It has the nice tactile style coating on the wear points of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Slightly tighter handle grip length as compared to FT840 series. It has the nice tactile style coating on the wear points of the handle (I cannot think of a way you would lose traction on this handle). In all, you can not go wrong with this purchase for a robust width stainless steel Mora blade. It facilitates stacking another Mora hard Craftline Series sheath to it. You can also attach it to an external button on your clothing if you are without a belt. Slicing regular food items a bit harder than regular width Mora blades. Its a Mora... buy it and smirk at the value in such a useful tool!
customer_reviews.author: David Messerschmidt

customer_reviews.title: everyone should own these
customer_reviews.text: mora is my everyday work/camp/Bushcraft knife super sharp out of the box and stays sharp easy to touch up with a strop. The sheath is no beauty contest winner but it is not meant to be, it is infinitely functional and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ajax

customer_reviews.title: Morakiv knives are the best value I have found to date
customer_reviews.text: Morakiv knives are the best value I have found to date. I have a few better built knives but not many. Buy a couple of these knives and you won't be disappointed. I love this knife. Carbon steel blade and extremely sharp as delivered. .125" thick and 3.6" length blade are great for everyday carry. IMO.
customer_reviews.author: grumpy old computer guy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: After buying one of these knives for a gift, I was really impressed with the quality. I ended up buying 2 more to give as gifts. The quality is excellent and they are razor sharp. Everyone that I've given them to has been very impressed. Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: bjm524

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, durable, awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome small knife. Stays sharp and it's easy to re-sharpen when you want to touch it up. Thick enough blade so that you can beat on the back of it with a mallet or piece of wood if you were splitting something. The tip is strong and robust. Have a few laying around and really enjoy them
customer_reviews.author: JTgatoring

customer_reviews.title: 1 down side... but I still love the knife
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife after watching a YouTube video. Amazing steel great handle and over all great knife. The only problem is the Scandinavian grind on the blade. Very sharp and holds a edge. But if you happen to mess up the bevel it is a good bit of work to get it sharp again. But other than that I would gladly buy this knife again
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boat, camp, hunt
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tough short blade knife. Holds an edge. Beat the s#!+ out of this thing and it just asks for more. Remember it is short. Not for batoning thick pieces.
customer_reviews.author: don boston

customer_reviews.title: A fine knife at an incredible price.
customer_reviews.text: A very good knife. highly recommend this knife. The cost is so low for such good quality and functionality that you can keep one in your tool box, another in the camping kit, one non your bug out bag and still another in the tackle box.
customer_reviews.author: woodlandsurvival

customer_reviews.title: Nice Knife
customer_reviews.text: Tough Knife. Comes very sharp. Back of blade is unfinished, only a downside if you're obsessive about such things. This is a work knife, not a showpiece. Cuts well and holds its edge. Remember to keep it oiled, as this is a carbon steel blade and will rust if not taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Gambit3le

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value, Excellent Quality.
customer_reviews.text: This item is a phenomenal value at twice the price. It's quality steel, well made and well thought out. Comes with a adequate sheath for most purposes, is vary sharp, and is comfortable to use. I have purchased multiple Mora Knives and happy with each and every one. I would recommend, I would buy again and intend to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Darin R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife, Greater Price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th MoraKniv and I am very pleased with it. Robust is a good name for it as it has a nice thick blade, thicker than the other Mora's I own. You really can't beat the quality for the price. Oh and the irregularities on the spine are actually normal for MoraKnives... Mora doesn't waste time polishing the spine in order to cut labor costs.
customer_reviews.author: Out West with Chris

customer_reviews.title: Blade responds well to blackening in vinegar
customer_reviews.text: At this price, what a steal. Great carbon steel, ridiculously sharp, comfy and safe grip I was curious about blackening, so I ran the blade a few rounds in heated vinegar. After thorough cleaning the blade is now dull dark gray, while still appearing sharp. Fun experiment, some rust protection as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing knife for the money! I ground the spine to 90* and treated the whole knife with Apple cider vinegar, then wrapped the sheath with electrical tape and duct tape. Great survival knife!
customer_reviews.author: Emens.Travels

customer_reviews.title: extremely sharp.
customer_reviews.text: I have many knives spyderco, victorinox, wenger, byrd, cold steel, buck, sog, leatherman, gerber, crkt and it is the sharpest knife, thickness is ideal for its size, tip is very sharp and strong
customer_reviews.author: rezi

customer_reviews.title: Could be thisa factory reject or a second
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, nice fitting handle. 4th Moraknif. The top of the blade wasn’t rounded or polished like my other knifes. I’m think this one got through quality control by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: DadeCityCharlie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little knife
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little knife, use mine every day keeps an edge pretty well and is super easy to sharpen. Wish it came with a sturdier sheath, I managed to crack mine within the first week or so of ownership. There are a lot of 3rd party sheath makers out there who make some nice kydex and leather replacement sheaths for not too much $ so replacing it hasn't been hard.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Once you go to Mora, you will never go back.
customer_reviews.text: Once you go to Mora you will never go back. The Craftline is best for kids (better than companion) as it has a guard to prevent slipping. Best value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Bjorn

customer_reviews.title: You'l be happy
customer_reviews.text: This knife is a bargain. It may not be the best knife available but it is for this price, it will exceed your expectations and you will be pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: JV Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. Feels very secure in the hand
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Feels very secure in the hand. After forceing a patina on the blade, I started to process fatwood into a pile of curls. Felt great, and has quickly become something that I use instead of the Mora Black. Extra large hands may have issues. I have Med glove size fingers and Large Glove size palms and the handle just fits very well. The rubberized texturing adds an amazing comfort and grip. I will update this review at the point of that surface breaking down so a durability/lifetime can be gauged.
customer_reviews.author: GentleVandal

customer_reviews.title: Mora FTW
customer_reviews.text: Sliced open my pinky good and deep on day one (due to my own mishandling) solid, sharp knife, with a reinforced handle that works great for pounding on things.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Morakniv
customer_reviews.text: Great knife! Sharp and durable. I use it all the time to carve and cut stuff. I love the sheath and how it snaps onto the knife and holds it in. I also like how comfortable the handle is with the rubber grip. The blade is straight and is the perfect length for any kind of work.
customer_reviews.author: ravenrock

customer_reviews.title: It's a Mora!
customer_reviews.text: Fits the hand well. Sharp from the manufacturer. It's a mora, you literally can't find a better blade for the price. I gave 4 stars due to the sheath. It already hung up on something while on my hip and broke. It is, however, a vast improvement over their other sheaths. Also I ground a good sharp 90 degree spot on the spine. That's just a personal preference and didn't effect my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Billings

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, sharp, good sheath, good steel. Not really for heavy work, but if I need to chop woos I bring an axe. Will not improve your social status but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: ToyoWilly

customer_reviews.title: I Can't Believe It's $16
customer_reviews.text: I carry it everywhere now. the $200 Benchmade was nice, but it sits in the drawer now. Razor sharp and stays that way. Perfect proportions for a TOOL, not a fashion statement. I work in a pulp mill, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Berlin A. Heck

customer_reviews.title: 2strong4me
customer_reviews.text: DBK made me buy one of these. I am not disappointed. You know a knife is strong when you can stab it into a stump and stand on it sideways.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S.

customer_reviews.title: speechless
customer_reviews.text: I am speechless The quality and the beauty of this knife are very excellent the way it feels in my hand and a plain versatility of it this is my second Morat knife I’ll be I’ll look into buying more in the future I added some patina got this one came out great
customer_reviews.author: dougpauline

customer_reviews.title: It's a glorious knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife lives up to it's name, it's robust. A friend and I bought this knife based on a review from Dutch Bushcraft knives and it's never let me down. The steel is very good and any damage that can be done to it can be repaired with a little work. It's become my edc and I've used it to do many tasks around the golf course I work at. The blade retention is god like even after using the knife to split logs up to 6 inches in diameter. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Zakari P.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Arrives razor sharp. The sheath is a bit cheap but it holds the knife securely and protects the blade. The blade is quite thick and will undoubtedly hold up to abuse. The rubberized handle affords a sure grip.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Real nice knife. Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Real nice knife. Looks good, feels great in the hand, locks into sheath firmly. Shorter thicker blade means only an idiot will break it. if you want grind the spine with 200 grit on a belt sander to use as a ferro rod striker. I'm not sure if i like the attach a knife to a knife system i mean What for? but its an option if you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Vargas

customer_reviews.title: I really like the shorter, thick blade for most tasks.
customer_reviews.text: I own a few other Mora brand knives. I appreciate the quality of the Mora knives and this model is no exception. I like the shorter, more robust blade and the rubberized handle. I want to buy the stainless steel version to carry in my float bag for when I go on raft or canoe trips on the river. I think the shorter blade is more practical for my needs on the river. Cutting ropes, opening food packages, and a thick enough blade to be used as a tool in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: David M Heaney

customer_reviews.title: No better knife for the price, seriously none!
customer_reviews.text: I was a skeptic because of the price, but because of the reviews decided to buy one and see for myself...I can't believe you get a knife this nice for such a cheap price!!! The knife is well made and comes pretty sharp. I am definitely a Mora fan now.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Can shave arm hair sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This is AMAZINGLY sharp, right out of the package! Not sure how durable the sheath will be in the field, but it seems pretty solid. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Sisson

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: The knife is awesome and feels great. I didn't notice this until my friend who creates gun and knife holsters looked at the knife, but the top of the knife wasn't smoothed. It doesn't take away from the knife at all, and my other Morakniv knife came 100% perfect.
customer_reviews.author: W1R3S

customer_reviews.title: An excellent EDC fixed blade
customer_reviews.text: An excellent EDC fixed blade. A no frills product that does what it is supposed to do. A nice size blade, thick enough to be real strong with a comfortable and well built handle. A decent sheath. For the price, it is hard to find a knife that competes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: My go to knive for skinning, firesticking, batoning small kindling
customer_reviews.text: Can't break it, holds edge well. Easy to sharpen. Quality hc steel at a great price. Blade length is perfect. Lightweight overall. Watch the review on YouTube channel Dutch bushcraft knives. They put this knife through the paces.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyDeuce

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the farm
customer_reviews.text: Love it just remember it's carbon and needs to be kept oiled if you don't want tarnish or rust Sharp and does the job
customer_reviews.author: Gerard M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bushcraft Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bushcraft knife for beginners, intermediate, and experts alike. It is extremely sharp right out of the box. My arm is missing hair as proof. You can featherstick, cut notches, even Baton small pieces of wood. (I say small because of the blade length) This is not a full tang spear point survival knife but it doesn't cost $100 plus either like the OKC Blackbird SK-5 (my favorite survival knife) so even if it were to break while processing wood that isn't a problem because you can buy them 10 at a time practically. I highly recommend this knife to anyone wanting a good bushcraft knife without wanting to spend $100 plus.
customer_reviews.author: H Younger

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: One of the best knives I have ever bought, came very sharp and so far has stayed that way. Have used it several times and so far it seems great and you really can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Hand down 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: It's hand down 5 stars all-purpose knife. Very thick steel and comfortable handle. Came sharp out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: san

product_meta.title: Morakniv Craftline Robust Trade Knife with Carbon Steel Blade and Combi Sheath, 3.6-Inch
product_meta.description: The Morakniv Craftline Robust Trade Knife features an extra-thick, 3.6 x 0.125-inch carbon steel fixed blade. High carbon steel achieves high hardness, sharpens easily and is exceptionally tough. High carbon steels are preferred in applications that demand durability and frequent regrinding. The material is harder than stainless steel, allowing it to hold a sharper and more durable acute edge. The Morakniv Robust has an impact-resistant, ergonomic TPE rubber handle with coil-formed rounding that provides extra grip and control. A finger guard provides additional safety. Included with the knife is a hard plastic Combi-Sheath, which provides a quick-connect feature for attaching a second knife and sheath. Morakniv has been manufacturing the highest quality knives in Mora, Sweden since 1891. Limited lifetime manufacturer's warranty.
feature_bullets: Fixed blade utility knife with an extra-think carbon steel blade for extra strength and durability
Blade Thickness: 0.125 in (0.32 cm), Blade Length: 3.6 in (9.1 cm), Total Length: 8.25 in (20.9 cm), Net Weight: 4.9 oz (140 g)
Ergonomic handle of TPE rubber provides optimum grip
Hard plastic Combi-Sheath allows for the connection of a second knife and sheath
